availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Granville Jasper Vaught (1st ky cavalry regiment)

body.p: Pulaski County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Pulaski County native. Married to Edna Vaught. Married to Maria M. Gragg Vaught in Pulaski County on March 2, 1865. Father of Sarah Vaught and George A. Vaught. Sergeant, first sergeant, and second lieutenant in the 1st Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) from September 11, 1861, to December 31, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 42-43.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pulaski County, District 1, p. 279-80.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Pulaski County Marriages, Film #000804052, p. 216-17.
Indiana Death Certificates (1899-2011), Indiana Archives and Records Administration, Indianapolis, Indiana, Roll #294, Boone County Deaths.
